org.dockbox.selene.core.objects.bossbar

Interface Bossbar

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultTickableBossbar, SpongeBossbar

    public interface Bossbar
    Represents a server-controlled bossbar instance.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Bossbar> REGISTRY
      The registry of all active bossbars.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static BossbarBuilder builder()
      Returns a assisted builder instance.
      static Exceptional<Bossbar> get(java.lang.String id)
      Returns a Bossbar instance based on a given id.
      static Exceptional<Bossbar> get(java.util.UUID uuid)
      Returns a Bossbar instance based on a given uuid.
      BossbarColor getColor()
      Gets the color of the current instance.
      java.lang.String getId()
      Returns the ID of the bossbar, typically this is registered in REGISTRY and a instance can be obtained using get(String).
      float getPercent()
      Gets the progress of the bossbar in a percentage between 0 and 100 (inclusive).

      Gets the style of the current instance.

      Gets the Text displayed by the current instance.

      Returns true if the current instance is visible/shown to the given Player, else false.

      Returns true if the current instance is visible/shown to the Player associated with the given name, else false.

      Shows the bossbar instance to the given Player for the given duration.
      java.util.Collection<Player> visibleTo()
      Returns all players to which the current instance is displayed to.

    • Field Detail

      • REGISTRY

        static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Bossbar> REGISTRY
        The registry of all active bossbars. Typically this only contains bossbars which are currently visible to at least one player.

    • Method Detail

      • showTo

        void showTo(Player player)
        Shows the bossbar instance to the given Player indefinitely.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to display the bossbar to.

      • showTo

        void showTo(Player player,
            java.time.Duration duration)
        Shows the bossbar instance to the given Player for the given duration.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to display the bossbar to.
        duration - The time duration to show the bossbar.

      • hideFrom

        void hideFrom(Player player)
        Hides/removes the bossbar instance from the given Player. If the bossbar was not visible to the player typically nothing is done.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to hide the bossbar from.

      • showTo

        void showTo(java.util.Collection<Player> players)
        Shows the bossbar instance to the given players indefinitely.
        Parameters:
        players - The collection of players to display the bossbar to.

      • hideFrom

        void hideFrom(java.util.Collection<Player> players)
        Hides/removes the bossbar instance from the given players. If the bossbar was not visible to one or more of the players typically nothing is done for that specific player.
        Parameters:
        players - The collection of players to hide the bossbar from.

      • getId

        java.lang.String getId()
        Returns the ID of the bossbar, typically this is registered in REGISTRY and a instance can be obtained using get(String). The ID does not have to be unique, making it so the instance in the REGISTRY may differ from the current instance.
        Returns:
        the id

      • getPercent

        float getPercent()
        Gets the progress of the bossbar in a percentage between 0 and 100 (inclusive).
        Returns:
        The progress of the bossbar as a percentage.

      • setPercent

        void setPercent(float percent)
        Sets the progress of the bossbar in a percentage between 0 and 100 (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        percent - The progress of the bossbar as a percentage.

      • getText

        Text getText()
        Gets the Text displayed by the current instance.
        Returns:
        The text displayed by the bossbar.

      • setText

        void setText(Text text)
        Sets the Text to be displayed by the current instance.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to be displayed.

      • getColor

        BossbarColor getColor()
        Gets the color of the current instance.
        Returns:
        The color of the bossbar.

        void setColor(BossbarColor color)
        Sets the color of the current instance.
        Parameters:
        color - The color of the bossbar.

      • getStyle

        BossbarStyle getStyle()
        Gets the style of the current instance.
        Returns:
        The style of the bossbar.

      • setStyle

        void setStyle(BossbarStyle style)
        Sets the style of the current instance.
        Parameters:
        style - The style of the bossbar.

      • visibleTo

        java.util.Collection<Player> visibleTo()
        Returns all players to which the current instance is displayed to.
        Returns:
        All players which can see the bossbar.

      • isVisibleTo

        boolean isVisibleTo(Player player)
        Returns true if the current instance is visible/shown to the given Player, else false.
        Parameters:
        player - The player
        Returns:
        true of the given player can see the bossbar.

      • isVisibleTo

        boolean isVisibleTo(java.util.UUID player)
        Returns true if the current instance is visible/shown to the Player associated with the given UUID, else false.
        Parameters:
        player - The UUID representation of a player.
        Returns:
        true of the given player can see the bossbar.

      • isVisibleTo

        boolean isVisibleTo(java.lang.String name)
        Returns true if the current instance is visible/shown to the Player associated with the given name, else false.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of a player.
        Returns:
        true of the given player can see the bossbar.

      • builder

        static BossbarBuilder builder()
        Returns a assisted builder instance.
        Returns:
        A new builder instance.

      • get

        static Exceptional<Bossbar> get(java.lang.String id)
        Returns a Bossbar instance based on a given id. This identifier typically matches with the one returned by getId(). If no instance exists, a empty Exceptional is returned.
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier of the potential bossbar
        Returns:
        The bossbar wrapped in a Exceptional, or empty.

      • get

        static Exceptional<Bossbar> get(java.util.UUID uuid)
        Returns a Bossbar instance based on a given uuid. This identifier typically matches with the one returned by getId(). If no instance exists, a empty Exceptional is returned.
        Parameters:
        uuid - The unique identifier of the potential bossbar
        Returns:
        The bossbar wrapped in a Exceptional, or empty.
